content.prompt: A system consists of several interacting objects. One of the objects, Object O, is free to move only in the x-direction under the influence of only conservative forces, while the other objects are fixed in place. The potential energy of the system as a function of Object O’s position is U(x)=kx4, where k is a positive constant. Can the motion of Object O be described as simple harmonic motion? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes. The displacement of Object O can be represented by a sinusoidal function of time.
Yes. The force exerted on Object O is in the opposite direction of Object O’s displacement from equilibrium.
No. The force exerted on Object O is not proportional to Object O’s displacement from equilibrium.
No. The total mechanical energy of the system does not remain constant while Object O is in motion.
